List.Item: This disc is to be used with Rocky5's 2016 Softmodding tool, not doing so could break your softmod or dashboards. You have been warned. I take no responsibility for your actions.
In this menu you can install applications to do various things, like add trainers to games or copy games to your HDD.
DVD2Xbox is used to rip game discs to your Xbox hardrive. It can also be used to rip audio CDs & DVD discs.

Item.arg2: This will install DVD2Xbox to C:\Applications\DVD2Xbox\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install DVD2Xbox to E:\Applications\DVD2Xbox\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: DVDX v2 is used to play DVD movies without the need for the DVD kit.

Item.arg2: This will install DVDX v2 to C:\Applications\DVDX v2\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's DVDX v2 installed to "C:\Applications\DVDX v2\"

Item.arg2: This will install DVDX v2 to E:\Applications\DVDX v2\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's DVDX v2 installed to "E:\Applications\DVDX v2\"
The EEPROM Backuperer is used to backup your current Xbox EEPROM. The output files will be placed in "E:\Backups\EEPROM\", note this is a silent app. ie, you will not get a GUI.

Item.arg2: This will install EEPROM Backuperer to C:\Applications\EEPROM Backuperer\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's EEPROM Backuperer installed to "C:\Applications\EEPROM Backuperer\"

Item.arg2: This will install the EEPROM Backuperer to E:\Applications\EEPROM Backuperer\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's EEPROM Backuperer installed to "E:\Applications\EEPROM Backuperer\"
This is a video mode switcher, that is used to switch a PAL console to an NTSC console, or visa versa.

Item.arg2: This will install Enigmah-X to C:\Applications\Enigmah-X\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install Enigmah-X to E:\Applications\Enigmah-X\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.
Are you sure you want to launch Enigmah-X?

List.Item: This will reinstall the NKPatcher Settings Shortcut into the Applications menu.

Item.arg2: This will install NKPatcher Settings launcher to E:\Applications\NKPatcher Settings\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's NKPatcher Settings installed to "E:\Applications\NKPatcher Settings\"
Xored Mini is used to apply trainers to your games. I include 882 trainers.

Item.arg2: This will install Xored Mini launcher to C:\Applications\Xored Mini\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's Xored Mini installed to "C:\Applications\Xored Mini\"

Item.arg2: This will install Xored Mini launcher to E:\Applications\Xored Mini\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: That's Xored Mini installed to "E:\Applications\Xored Mini\"
In this menu you can install alternative dashboards to replace the default one installed after the softmod. Note: All dashboards can be installed as applications.

Item.arg2: This will install Avalaunch to C:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in E:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is not needed, but it would clean up your E drive & stop confusion down the road.
This will install Avalaunch to E:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in C:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is required for the E:\Dashboard\ to load on boot.
This will install Avalaunch to C:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install Avalaunch to E:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install EvolutionX to C:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in E:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is not needed, but it would clean up your E drive & stop confusion down the road.
This will install EvolutionX to E:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in C:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is required for the E:\Dashboard\ to load on boot.
This will install EvolutionX to C:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install EvolutionX to E:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install UnleashX to C:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in E:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is not needed, but it would clean up your E drive & stop confusion down the road.
This will install UnleashX to E:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in C:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is required for the E:\Dashboard\ to load on boot.
This will install UnleashX to C:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install UnleashX to E:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: If you would like to find out what this is you can checkout my walk-through on Youtube.

Item.arg2: This will install XBMC4Kids to C:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in E:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is not needed, but it would clean up your E drive & stop confusion down the road.
This will install XBMC4Kids to E:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in C:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is required for the E:\Dashboard\ to load on boot.

List.Item: Due to the way this dashboard works, it must be installed as a Dashboard. It uses a custom Python script that allows multiple save directories for each profile & installing this as an Applications can effect other things.

Item.arg2: This will install XBMC4Xbox to C:\Dashboard\ if there is currently a dashboard residing there it will be overwritten.
Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in E:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is not needed, but it would clean up your E drive & stop confusion down the road.

Would you like to remove the Dashboard located in C:\Dashboard\ if it exists? This is required for the E:\Dashboard\ to load on boot.
This will install XBMC4Xbox to C:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install XBMC4Xbox to E:\Applications\ if there is a previous installation residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: Some mods & Homebrew for you lot to install & try out.
Just a few homebrew games all setup & ready to play.

This is a PC port of Alien vs Predator by SirLemonhead & it functions surprisingly well, considering the port was abandoned. This version uses the unreleased beta that fixed most issues with the original release.
AVP Gold installed to.\n\n"E:\Homebrew\Aliens versus Predator Gold\"
AVP Gold installed to.\n\n"F:\Homebrew\Aliens versus Predator Gold\"
AVP Gold installed to.\n\n"G:\Homebrew\Aliens versus Predator Gold\"
This allows you to play Doom, Doom II, Ultimate Doom, Final Doom: TNT Evilution & Final Doom: Plutonia Exp.
Super Mario War is a Super Mario multiplayer game. The goal is to stomp as many other Marios as possible to win the game. It's a tribute to Nintendo and the game Mario War by Samuele Poletto.
Super Mario War installed to.\n\n"E:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8\"
Super Mario War installed to.\n\n"F:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8\"
Super Mario War istalled to.\n\n"G:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8\"
Super Mario War is a Super Mario multiplayer game. The goal is to stomp as many other Marios as possible to win the game. It's a tribute to Nintendo and the game Mario War by Samuele Poletto.
Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition installed to.\n\n"E:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition\"
Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition installed to.\n\n"F:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition\"
Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition installed to.\n\n"G:\Homebrew\Super Mario War 1.8 Halloween Edition\"
Play Duke Nukem 3D on the XBOX!, also supports loading of SHIT LOADS OF MODS!.
Just a few mods of mine & one from CrazyChris.

Mod by Rocky5

For information on this mod please
read the Info.txt file located in

"D:\Games\Mods\FIFA 07"

There is to much to list here.

Addons created/converted by Rocky5 & Bless

For information on this mod please
read the Info.txt file located in

"D:\Games\Mods\Operation Flashpoint Elite"

There is to much to list here.
Create the following Profiles to unlock the Hidden cheat menu. Once the following profiles have been created the hidden features menu will be unlocked.

Cheat options:
Enhanced view distance and ambient life
"Dentist Guba"
Same as Dentist Guba then some more stuff
"QA Tester"
Unlocks everything
"XaX 1985"

Now that you have unlocked the hidden menus it's time to activate them. From any menu you hold the left trigger and the white button simultaneously. A menu will appear. Now press right on the DPAD and this should enable the option you have selected.
You will know you have toggling the option correctly when you receive a message in the top left corner that says "hidden objects unlocked.

Mod by Rocky5

1. New Cockpit view
2. New sounds
3. New Skins for cars 512x512 or 1024x1024
4. New weather effects
5. New Car damage
6. Loads of small tweaks and changes
Enter your profile name as: Creole

Mod by CrazyChris

For information on this mod please
read the Info.txt file located in

"D:\Games\Mods\WWE Wrestlemania XXI"

There is to much to list here.
Just some things that don't belong in other sub menus.
These are not used as a default dashboard, but can be installed to allow you to copy CD's to the Xbox for playback in some games or to manage your save games.

list.Item: This was the last official dashboard MS released for the Xbox.

Item.arg2: Proceed with installation? \n\nMS Dashboard total size is 138MB

list.Item: I'm about to clean up the C drive.

Item.arg2:
Install the Audio? 

This is not needed for the dashboard to function. 

Audio increases the total size to 171MB

list.Item:
Feature list. 

1) Defaults to Games Saves list. 
2) XBL functionality removed. 
3) Smaller footprint. 
4) Update Safe.

Item.arg2: Proceed with installation? \n\nMS Dashboard total size is 65MB

list.Item: I'm about to clean up the C drive.

This is not needed for the dashboard to function.

list.Item: I'm about to clean up the C drive.

List.Item: Doing this can help with some games or applications that are crashing or refusing to boot.
In this menu you can update your 2016 Softmod to the latest version, or upgrade older softmods as well as revert to a stock Xbox.
If you don't know what these do, or you don't know how they work, do not use them. I take no responsibility for you mucking about with things you don't understand.

This option is for upgrading your 2014 
softmod installation to the 2016 version. 

Your current dashboard will not be effected.

Item.arg2:
I'm about to do some checks, to makes 
sure you're running my 2014 Softmod kit. 

Continue with the Upgrade?

List.Item: OK it would appear you're running my 2014 Softmod, so I will continue onto the next step.

This option is for updating your 2016 
softmod installation to the latest version. 

Your current dashboard will not be effected.

Item.arg2:
I'm about to do some checks, to makes 
sure you're running my 2016 Softmod. 

Continue with the Upgrade?

List.Item: OK it would appear you're running my 2016 Softmod, so I will continue onto the next step.

Item.arg2:
This option is for upgrading your old non 
2016 softmod or it can be used to install 
a clean installation of the 2016 Softmod. 

Are you sure you want to do this?

List.Item: Please note, this option will revert your Xbox to the state it was in when originally purchased. ie, all content from the E partition will be removed, this includes Applications, Saves, DLC & any other content residing on the E partition.

I will also install all the exploitable saves so you can resoftmod the system at a later date. I also include the UDDAE exploit so you can resoftmod the system without needing one of the exploitable games.

Item.arg2: Are you sure you want to continue?

List.Item: These applications are to be used by people that know what they are doing. I take no responsibility for users formatting or breaking there Xbox.
This is the latest version of Chimp & it supports all Xbox versions. You use Chimp to install larger HDD's for Softmodded Xbox's, please search Youtube for "Chimp 261812"

Item.arg2: This will install Chimp 261812 to E:\Applications\Chimp\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: XBpartitioner is used to Format large HDD's, mainly the Extra Partitions (F & G) after cloning with Chimp. So please be careful with this applications. It's other use, is custom partitions.

Item.arg2: This will install XBpartitioner to C:\Applications\XBpartitioner\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.
This will install XBpartitioner to E:\Applications\XBpartitioner\ if there is currently a application residing there it will be overwritten.

List.Item: Be careful when using this, as you can potentially remove something you're not meant to.

Item.arg2: Are you sure you want to disable the ShadowC partition?
Are you 100% sure you want to disable the ShadowC partition?
Are you 100% sure, you're 100% sure, you want to disable the ShadowC partition?
